welcome_message_body: "Welcome to Ami, Japan! With its stunning natural beauty, rich cultural heritage, and delicious local cuisine, this charming city has something for everyone. We invite you to immerse yourself in all that Ami has to offer and make unforgettable memories."

terminals.name: Main Terminal
terminals.description: The main terminal at Ibaraki Airport serves both domestic and international flights.

terminals.name: Cargo Terminal
terminals.description: The cargo terminal at Ibaraki Airport handles the transportation of goods and freight.

wifi.note: Free wifi is available throughout the airport.

terminals.name: Terminal 1
terminals.description: The largest terminal at Narita International Airport, serving a variety of international airlines.

terminals.name: Terminal 2
terminals.description: A modern terminal with a spacious design, mainly used by Japan Airlines and its partners.

terminals.name: Terminal 3
terminals.description: A smaller terminal used for low-cost carriers and domestic flights.

wifi.note: Passengers can connect to the free Wi-Fi network for up to 3 hours per day.
